main event: The report describes a sighting of a large, bright white, round object with a tail that hovered, rotated, and moved slowly over Conrad, Montana on March 21, 1953.
interesting points: The object dropped straight down and moved from left to right several times before going due west and dropping lower, then disappearing.
The object was observed from Conrad, Montana and was about 35-40 miles west of the observers' location.
The sighting lasted for an unknown amount of time, but the object disappeared at 0552Z.
The observers were a family from Conrad, Montana, and they reported the sighting to the authorities.
The evaluation of the sighting is unclear from the report.
sighted object: a large, bright white, round object with a tail
